Description: Cypriot terracotta figure of horned man with arms outreached. Handmade, with traces of black paint. Missing one arm and legs. Light grey/ buff fabric with fine white, black and red inclusions. White residue on surface, may be the remnants of a decorative coating.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ16 or 17
Curator's comments: This horned character’s closest parallels are of a toy centaur of the type that would have wheels and a hole for a stick to be inserted to push it around centaur (Karageorghis 1996, 7 figs 4, 5 pl. 5.3 Types A15). However there are representations of horned gods in this region that may also be represented by this figure. Karageorghis, V. 1996. The coroplastic art of ancient Cyprus. VI. The Cypro-Archaic Period monsters, animals and miscellanea. Nicosia, University of Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.074) (Phase 1)
